website_summaries.verdict: Aside from a few quirks, these men's KEENs top the pack when it comes to handsome design and comfortable wear suitable for a variety of purposes.
pros: Versatile, sleek black leather oxfords that look good enough for dressy occasions
Provide all-day comfort for frequent standing or walking thanks to the interior cushioning, toe protection, and rugged rubber soles
cons: Though they are supposed to be slip-resistant, this may not be the case on all surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit good, but started to tear on the left shoe only after owning them for two months. I expected Keen shoes to last longer based on their reputation. I will never buy another pair. Extremely dissatisfied.. 👎🏻👎🏻
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: I've tried to listen to my co-workers and have tried every other kind of boot there is and have wasted so much money
customer_reviews.text: I'm a full-time firefighter/paramedic and are up on my feet all the time. I've tried to listen to my co-workers and have tried every other kind of boot there is and have wasted so much money. I saw another co-worker wearing these one day and he stated once you try them you wont go back. I gave it a try and now on my 2nd pair. Love them, don't hesitate just buy them!
customer_reviews.author: Quinn A.

customer_reviews.title: Love Keens but quality is disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Throughly disappointed in this shoe. Had them sitting new in the box until February of 2018 as I unexpectedly given new shoes. Was using them 5 to 7 days a week for 12 to 18 hours and foam is already torn and missing in the toe box and outside edge of my feet. I expected $100 shoes to last longer than a month and a half. The nonslip is phenomenal but there is no point if my feet are hurting. I'm 6 foot 190 lbs and wear size 12. I love keens but these were horrid.
customer_reviews.author: Wrestler2

customer_reviews.title: Nice restaurant shoes, non slip works well
customer_reviews.text: Great bar tending work shoes. Nice non slip and super supportive. They are a bit stiff, I wore them around the house for a day, before I wore them at work. Roomy toe box in case you hadn’t noticed from pictures. My feet are much happier after my shifts behind the bar. Some of the staff loves the look of the shoes, others think they look clunky. They work well with our all black uniforms( mirrors my soul after 25 years bartending) but the style is not everyone’s favorite. I think they look great.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Davis

customer_reviews.title: NOT Anti Slip
customer_reviews.text: definitely not slip resistant as advertised these things are like ice skates on a kitchen floor had previous skechers brand that was awesome but thought would spend more for a potentially better shoe what a disappointment. I had bought a second pair of skechers at the same time. the Skechers are comfortable and do not slip and slide all over the floor. my coworkers laughed and teased me because I fell on my a-- like 3 times in one shift. I have never worn again and am completely out the money because wore them but never again too dangerous! maybe anti slip on the sandy beach but not in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great work shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great work shoe, I've worn these for years. The non-slip soles do however, seem a little bit more prone to slip than previous versions. I don't know if they changed the material or what. Seems like the sole is made of a different compound or different manufacturer. All around great shoe, comfortable to wear but I don't see how they can call them slip resistant anymore. I wear them on the same floors as before, only now I have to be very careful around wet or oily surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Mathis

customer_reviews.title: Broke in out of the box
customer_reviews.text: These required no break in period and were comfortable straight out of the box. The toe box is nice and roomy. They do not fit narrow at all, I wouldn’t say they’re a true wide but they’re wider than typical shoes. They’re a nice deep black and have memory foam insoles. I’ve been wearing Dr Martens pretty much exclusively since the mid 90s but they’re starting to not be as comfortable in my 40s as they were in my teens and 20s so I decided to give Keen a try and I’m glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Twashy

customer_reviews.title: Something changed but not for the better
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought these shoes several times before from a local shoe store & loved them. Not sure what’s different this time but never have they worn out so quickly. I used to always get 6 months or more out of them. I’m so disappointed that I already have to replace them. In 3 1/2 months they are shot. I will not order these again.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Great work shoe's
customer_reviews.text: I am on my feet 11 hours a day at work. Keen work shoes have saved my feet and extended my work day. I come home and can still do more around the house. Great comfort and traction for slippery conditions at work. I never liked the way keen looked through the toe area but after trying them on advise from a friend,I quickly learned to look past it. They are the most comfortable shoes I own. I am on pair number 5 and will not change to another brand. I even now have Keen hiking boots for the same reason. Great shoe's and boot's!
customer_reviews.author: Alisha M.

customer_reviews.title: Creak! Creak! Creak!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have a nice, wide toe box. Perfect for someone like me whose feet like a lot of lateral space. There is, however, a problem that I cannot fix and that is that they squeak (or creak) when I walk. It is not the insoles. It seems to becoming from inside the sole. I have a second pair of Keens (brown) that do not make a sound. So, I assume it is this specific pair. Has anyone else had this problem?
customer_reviews.author: Glia Man

customer_reviews.title: Really good shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Keen brand shoes for about 10 years and this last pair are as good as the first pair. The fit and finish are just what I've become accustomed to and the shoe quality has remained consistent for the price paid. The latest pair of shoes provided all day comfort with about 80% of my 10 hour day standing or walking. I usually try to do a short break in for new shoes but my schedule demanded a full first day on concrete industrial floors. Keen is a premium brand for people that count on great equipment.
customer_reviews.author: DP  in Indy

customer_reviews.title: 2 birds 1 shoe
customer_reviews.text: My husband has flat feet and works in a dirty environment, he kept complaining about his feet hurting and that he couldn't get his shoes clean because of the dust on the ground. I searched Google, and googled some more and came across these which would solve both problems. I purchased them for fathers day, and hes been wearing them ever since. Hasn't complained about his feet and is so happy he can just wipe his shoes down at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal G.

customer_reviews.title: Probably not again....
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit well and have held up reasonably well (though I have a desk job and am very easy on them) For the first 4+ months they were the most annoying shoe ever! There was an odd squeak from the leather rubbing on the tongue to the outside of the shoe . I tried mink oil etc and nothing seems to help until the wore in.
customer_reviews.author: CCE525

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes but not non-slip
customer_reviews.text: I love Keens and this is the 4th time that I bought this shoes for my husband. Long story short this time the shoes were not non-slip and my husband felt the very first day he wore them at work.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Love these work shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Great work shoes for someone on their feet all day. I don’t work in a kitchen so haven’t had the problem with them “not being slip resistant” as in other reviews but I do work in a hotel and haven’t had a problem. Comfortable and will buy another pair when these ones get old. Had them for a couple months and still living them.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Korte

customer_reviews.title: These things pay for themselves with how long they last and are much more comfortable and way better for my back/knees/etc
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my 2nd pair, but they've lasted over 3 years combined and my current pair still has a lot of life left in them. I work full time as a restaurant server and am always on my feet. I used to skimp on cheaper shoes, but never will again. These things pay for themselves with how long they last and are much more comfortable and way better for my back/knees/etc. than what I use to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality going downhill
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart after five months. I expect to replace work shoes on a yearly basis and Keen Utility's dress oxfords used to make it that far. This pair didn't make it. The tread was gone after four months and the uppers separated from the sole after five. They were great while they lasted--good slip resistance, very comfortable, attractive appearance, good support--but the value isn't there anymore. I hate to abandon a brand that's worked out well for me over the years, but I'm looking elsewhere now.
customer_reviews.author: Garden Guy

customer_reviews.title: Shoe wears out easily
customer_reviews.text: It was comfortable, nice wide toes. The rubber wears out fast. The leather holds up. It is expensive so I was hoping for some durability with the sole. For the price, I would go with Doc Martins or something, way more durable and just as comfortable. I am a social worker and wear them quite a bit. If I was at my prior job where I walked a lot, these would have lasted about 4 months. They have lasted me over a year and the tread is completely worn, the sides are crunched, yada, yada.
customer_reviews.author: david webb

customer_reviews.title: Great option for chefs who don't like Crocs.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only shoe that my husband wears for work. Working in restaurants requires him to wear non-slip, non-skid shoes. These are comfortabl. durable and are a great choice for any chefs out there who aren't on the "Crocs" bandwagon. They also last him anywhere from 1-2 years before needing a new pair. I think we are on his 4th or 5th pair.
customer_reviews.author: Gerszewski Family

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing about a month everyday. I'm on my feet pretty much all day, seem to be pretty good support. Not the stylish shoes I've purchased, but work for me. Third pair of Keen's for me. Last two pair lasted a year wearing daily so I hope the same for these as well.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: These Shoes Fit and feel So Good, I bought A Second Pair
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, onto my feet, they feel great. I wore them to work the next day and decided to buy another pair. I purchased my firs pair on 20170127, ordered the second pair on 20170131. The fit is perfect and I like the front because I work in an area where you can scuff up the toe badly. Absolutely no slipping in these shoes and I feel as though they provide excellent support.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Michaels

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky shoe with great fit and comfort
customer_reviews.text: Squeaky shoe with great fit and comfort... Truly I love these Keen shoes, they are all day comfortable, strong support, good traction. However the leather tounge rubs against the leather side and makes the slightest squeak sound ... if not for that I’d give it a 5/5 stars, so 4/5 stars .
customer_reviews.author: Mike R PE

customer_reviews.title: worst............shoes...............ever
customer_reviews.text: I have been an avid Keen Oxford fan for many years. The recent pair, previous pair purchased about 1.5 years ago, sounds like 2 balloons rubbing together. They are so loud that my office colleagues begged me to take them off in the office. Keen kindly replaced them with a new pair, and the problems persist. Seems that the low quality leather and finish on leather they changed to about 1 year ago is really showing. I understand controlling costs, but at the cost of customers, not sure how long that will last. That said, no worries as they now have one less customer, for life, to worry about
customer_reviews.author: WACTB

customer_reviews.title: Fit just right, will likely get more comfortable as I wear them.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, fast delivery. I ordered size 7.5, and they fit great. I tried them on wearing shorts (see pics) but plan to wear them with pants. Nice conservative, professional looking shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Day 1 - most comfortable work shoe
customer_reviews.text: Day 1 - most comfortable work shoe. Slip resistant soles work exceptionally well on Clinker Tile (floor in dealership shop) when covered in oil and coolant. Day 2 the break in starts, somewhat uncomfortable for a few days and after that, comfortable shoes. About 3 months of normal 8am-5pm shifts the insole at the heel is falling apart and imagine a rock in the shoe, that's what its like with the insole falling apart. The sides where the ankle bone has worn the material off. I haven't experienced this with other shoes. I have filed a warranty request but it clearly states normal wear and tear not covered, but for 110, I expected higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Prior to buying, I had read some negative feedback ...
customer_reviews.text: Prior to buying, I had read some negative feedback for this product, stating that it was not the typical Keen quality they expected. This made me weary. I've found this shoe to be the high quality that I expected from Keen. I wear these everyday full time at work and they are holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: randy lee

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for foot, knee and back pain!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband works in a VERY busy bar that has no floor mats. In his old shoes he was having excruciating foot, knee and back pain, ever since he switched to Keen, everything feels worlds better!! He is definitely hooked for good!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler & Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Good kitchen shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite kitchen shoes. Though I haven’t tried many I did look up a lot of recommendations. Tried Birkis, which were too uncomfortable and with too little support. One downside is ventilation isn’t great if that’s a concern. Otherwise super comfortable, good durability, water proof, slip resistant basic black shoes. I got the extra cushy inserts when a I bought it and haven’t looked back.
customer_reviews.author: Elevenses

customer_reviews.title: this shoe is very comfortable and just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Keen's tend to run small, sometimes nearly a half size, I wear an 11.5 W/EW in most brands, so I have to order a 12 in most Keen models. Overall, this shoe is very comfortable and just what I was looking for...a business casual shoe that fits like my Voyageur light hikers.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff A. Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes...No more sore feet
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are incredibly comfortable and I'm actually looking to pick up another pair in a different color. I've been a huge fan of Keen sandals due to their amazing comfort and indestructibility...looks like these same traits are in these shoes. The only cons I notice are that they don't breathe too well if you're just sitting all day. If you walk a lot like I do then no problem. Also stylistically they lean more towards a hiking boot and may not work in a business casual setting. Very minor issues though. If you want long lasting, supremely comfortable, casual shoes...look no further!
customer_reviews.author: Joe D

customer_reviews.title: Solid work footwear
customer_reviews.text: These are good hard working shoes. I'm a retail pro and spend 9-10 hours a day on my feet on a tile floor. These shoes have been great.
customer_reviews.author: KrisVC

customer_reviews.title: I really like them, but
customer_reviews.text: The nonslip soles wear out way to fast. the upper leather is really great at resisting oil and food, but I would find myself slipping all of time after a few months. I went with the MOZO Forza this last time from SFC, I find their non-slip soles last longer. Overall I really like the style and I will probably purchase again in the future
customer_reviews.author: Arlie Turman

customer_reviews.title: Shoes Fit Well but Squeak a Lot
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit well and have the usual Keen comfort but they sure make a racket. I go squeak-squeak every where I go. My co-workers get a laugh by making fun of me going by. The leather (or fake leather) does not bend silently, it makes a squeaking sound every time it bends. Generally I have stopped wearing these shoes and will think twice before buying Keens online again without a try on.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: The fit the Arches and the wide toe box and anti-slip soles the shoes are perfect for me.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these shoes a year ago for work I'm a machinist, and I stand on my feet 10 hours a day. The shoes have lasted a whole year and there's still some left. I am very pleased with the quality and the fit and feel of these shoes. I previously bought the other shoes at a shoe store, so I looked online and bought the same ones and he actually saved about $38. I would recommend these Keen shoes to anybody that works the stands all day, the toe box is wide it's just really comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Art Z

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Only gave 4 stars as the quality seems to be sliding a bit. Have been wearing this style for 10 years now and really like them but will have to wait and see if this pair holds up like the last several have.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Trefz

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: I've been a fan of Keen's Oxford shoes for 8 years now. I've owned around six pair in that time. But not anymore. Keen must have changed manufacturers because this shoe is not the same. The material is cheaper, thinner, stiffer. It is very uncomfortable. And they squeak. Constantly squeak. Not worth the $100 anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Keens rock!
customer_reviews.text: Love Keens. I've had foot surgery on both feet so Keens are all I can wear. They're real comfy right out of the box. Never had to "break in" a pair of Keens.
customer_reviews.author: M. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Not very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Ugh. I love the design of these shoes but there's very little cushioning for the balls of your feet and the overall feel inside is like walking on concrete, barefoot. For the amount of money for these shoes, I would expect far better padding inside. A waste of my money. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Daranhatu

customer_reviews.title: Great work shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Nice work shoes. At first I was not impressed looking at them. The leather looked more like glove leather than shoe leather and I expected them to scuff easily. I was wrong they have held up and still look nice in a rough environment that often scuffs shoes. The size is consistent within the range of Keen shoes. I wear a 8.5 men's shoe in Keen and have had a good run with being able to order them through the internet for years.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Wennemar

customer_reviews.title: Winner!
customer_reviews.text: Keen has excellent shoes and these are no exception. My husband absolutely LOVES these! He is on his feet all day at his shop so comfort and durability were required. "These are the best shoes I have ever had!" he says. Fit well, comfortable even at the end of his long work day, and not easy to mess up. Very good buy and delivered very quickly with Prime. YAY!
customer_reviews.author: Marie W.

customer_reviews.title: Slightly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: They were squeaky and I had to apply some leather conditioner on the tongue to eliminate that. They are not assembled in the US like my last pair of Keens. Time will tell if they’re as good as my last pair.
customer_reviews.author: RH777

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable work shoe ever.
customer_reviews.text: I'd have given five stars if they offered a size 15 because I could use a bit more toe room. I've tried so many different work shoes and I always come back to these. Simply the most comfortable work shoes I've ever had. They also have a long lasting upper, especially the laces. They will outlast your shoes and probably the next pair. The only issue other than not offering bigger sizes is the padding wears out and the foam starts popping out for me. It takes about six months for this to happen so it's not a deal breaker for me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Labus

customer_reviews.title: The sole has good traction I work in a hospital and do lots ...
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of toe box room I usually select an EE width. The insole is much nicer than most factory insoles. Powerstep Pinnacle insoles in these would be more arch support but less cushion, Sorbothane ultra graphite insoles give more shock absorption but less arch support than the Powerstep Pinnacle. You can customize the feel of the shoe by which insole you select. The sole has good traction I work in a hospital and do lots of walking I like this shoe very much.
customer_reviews.author: Old Boots

customer_reviews.title: Solid. Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve worked professionally in the kitchen for over 25 years. I wore Birkenstock’s for much of that time. They stopped making the pair that I wore so I needed ca new shoe. After reading many reviews I decided to try them. There’re great! I’m on my second pair. They don’t last as long as my Birkenstock’s did but they are much less expensive. I recommend these to anyone working in a commercial kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soles and insoles wear out in three months. Comfy ...
customer_reviews.text: Soles and insoles wear out in three months. Comfy, but having to replace every three months is ridiculous. Bought new insoles from keen just to have the shoes fall apart in another two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Sheik

customer_reviews.title: Not for restaurants
customer_reviews.text: The shoes is fine, but advertised as a restaurant shoe. That is not the case. Yes they are comfortable and water proof, but no where near the slip resistance as your average Shoe for Crew. I bartend and I do not even feel confident walking over water spills let alone through the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Werker

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for a kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Fits well, comfortable, nice enough to wear outside of work while maintaining a professional appearance. Seems sturdy. Only one problem; I bought these to wear at my restaurant job, and it does not maintain traction on the kitchen floor. I was slipping and sliding so bad I decided to switch back to my old Keen shoes at work for now. Despite being two years old and beat to hell, the tread on those shoes is still far and away better.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Rhoderick

customer_reviews.title: The second pair are a size 12 and the fit great. These shoes have a wide toe area
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size 13 the first time because I have Keen sandals in that size. They were too long. The second pair are a size 12 and the fit great. These shoes have a wide toe area, my toes are not squished together. Great for diabetics.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable and met my needs being a bartender in the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these shoes that I've purchased. The first pair I bought functioned and fit flawlessly; very, very comfortable and met my needs being a bartender in the restaurant industry. This new pair, however, seems to have no traction whatsoever. Is there something I can do to increase the traction of the these shoes such that they grip the floor and gain traction as well as the first pair?
customer_reviews.author: Cheshire

customer_reviews.title: I've tried other brands that might "look" better but simply don't stand the test of time and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used Keen Utility shoes at work for decades, they hold up very well in the Restaurant/Food service world. I've tried other brands that might "look" better but simply don't stand the test of time and every day use as these do.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen T Peterson

customer_reviews.title: My favorite work shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are solid work shoes with good arch support right out of the box. I have arthritic feet and these shoes are the most comfortable shoes that I've been able to find, without spending an insane amount of money. My job is pretty hard on shoes and these Keens soak up a large amount of punishment before being sent to the garbage heap. This is my third pair, and as long as Keen keeps making them, I will keep buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B. Healy

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: I put shoes through hell and these are holding up nice. good toe protection while stopping heavy swinging doors (without having a steel toe) and very very non slip, probably the best non slip shoe I've owned. All the crevices in the sole hold onto grime but I guess thats the price to pay for good nonslip safety. Overall nice shoe
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect kitchen shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I spend a lot of hours at work. The materials are high quality and the slip-resistant soles last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: taco_savior504

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, seem durable, look nice.
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes, very comfortable and look professional enough for the work I do (business casual/casual). My biggest (only) gripe is that the soles squeak like crazy on the polished concrete floor at my work. Not really anywhere else, but something about the sealant and these shoes makes a lot of noise.
customer_reviews.author: NizleHop

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes. Wore them in a manufacturing environment for almost three years. Just bought another pair.
customer_reviews.author: toolman61

customer_reviews.title: Nice pair of shoe's
customer_reviews.text: As of right now they fit well. The only problem I have with then is they are stiff. Once the shoes are broke in I don't see me having any trouble out of them. They seem very well made. As you can see I'm very ruff on my work shoes. The ones in the pic are a pair of Sketchers that are only five months old.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: All around good shoe
customer_reviews.text: I'm tuff on chef shoes I've tried them all and these hold up for almost 6 month which is more than most, they start getting really flimsy and loose, they lose there structure and junk likes to get in laces but that a given for cooking. I'm they are better if you do a lot on moving instead of clog style which work if you are standing in one place, these are catering style alpurpuse shoes. My second pair!
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Best comfort in a work shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Keen quality and comfort! And approved non-slip sole and all black color for work. I wish I had found these sooner. Only petty gripe is the leather creaks alot, but it just helps me pretend I'm batman.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: i was a bit skeptical about the shoe but it was recommended by a friend in the medical field. and Boy were they right. These shoes are very comfortable. the only thing I didn't like but appreciate now is how loose they get once worn in, but this added looseness helps in walking comfort and lessens foot fatigue. I highly recommend. no need for for extra shoe insoles.
customer_reviews.author: Muraad McCoy

customer_reviews.title: They aren't quite as cosmetically cool but that's not why we bought them
customer_reviews.text: If you want a shoe you can walk in forever these are them. They aren't quite as cosmetically cool but that's not why we bought them. My son wore these all day and said "no foot pain or tired legs".
customer_reviews.author: Suzanna

customer_reviews.title: ... of keens for about a decade and they never disappoint. These are just as good as all the ...
customer_reviews.text: have had at least one pair of keens for about a decade and they never disappoint. These are just as good as all the rest. Thank you Keen for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: E.K.

customer_reviews.title: The shoes are comfortable but the non-slip sole could be better
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are comfortable but the non-slip sole could be better. Wet surfaces are too slippery. The rubber tread provide little traction on snow and if there is ice, the shoes become like ice skates.
customer_reviews.author: Kermit

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable when on feet all day.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son's food service job after trying several other "name brand" comfort shoes and these are the only ones that he never got sore feet or pain with. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Myriam

customer_reviews.title: Super slippery at first
customer_reviews.text: Super slippery at first, felt like I was on skates. Probably more comfortable if you worked a normal 8 hour shift, but at the end of 11 to 12 hours my feet are a little sore. After a few days they are not as slippery as they were, but still slide around a bit when walking a little fast in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: S o s a

customer_reviews.title: These shoes squeak a lot when you walk in them.
customer_reviews.text: I loved my first pair of Keen's. They were a little goofy looking but they were high quality. Those shoes were not available anymore so I ordered the oxfords. The support is ok but not like the others and I don't believe they are made out of leather. They squeak a lot and loudly. I doubt I'll buy another pair of Keens unless the other pair become available again.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect work shoes
customer_reviews.text: Amazing work shoes. I work at PF Changs and im on my feet all day so these save my feet and legs. I have EXTREMELY flat feet with no arch. I notice these have good arch support but with my jacked up feet i still need my orthotics in them. But no biggie these are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret L.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, KEEN makes a great product and as ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, KEEN makes a great product and as someone with wide feet, I really enjoy their generous toe box. I walk a lot for work and enjoy these shoes. They do loose one star in that the laces keep coming undone and needed to be replaced with laces providing a better knot grip.
customer_reviews.author: E. D. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: They are NOT slip resistant at all
customer_reviews.text: One star because it claims to be non slip/slip resistant butthey are not in the least bit. Very comfortable but the smallest amt of water or oil and its like walking on ice. It even says slip resistant on the sole. I only bought them for work in a kitchen but they are useless. For $114, there much better alternatives out there that actually are slip resistant
customer_reviews.author: J.R

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Perfect! Look great!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes! The look great and feel amazing! Thru do squeak a little as they are new leather, but I think it's funny... So happy with the quality and everything!
customer_reviews.author: Monkey 5

customer_reviews.title: The fit is always great, I have bought these shoes from more then ...
customer_reviews.text: The fit is always great, I have bought these shoes from more then 4 years now. However this last pair is extremely slippery when they are supposed to be slip resistant not sure what the issue is. Maybe there is a coating that needs to wear off. Not to sure Late edit- these shoes were not good. Sorry Keen and Amazon I gave them a chance. The slippery soles were to dangerous to deal with. I now have moved away from Keen
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No vents, not--all day on your feet--comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shape, good looks, and you can polish them. However, no heat vents and high price removes two stars. $65-70 price would make it four stars. An improvement over two other pairs of shoes, but still not--all day on your feet comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: I have bought 4 pairs before that word the best work should I ever had
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased for Keen utility shoes over the past years two pair I currently have that I bought does not fit field or even hold 4 non slip I can wear my old Keen shoes and they don't slip my new Keen shoes slip all the time and I don't know why but something is very different I was happy to see the price was less I don't know if this has something to do with the quality but they're not the same
customer_reviews.author: james waters

customer_reviews.title: love keens, and love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: love keens, and love these shoes. they are perfect for work and i wear them all day, and then to the gym. my only con is that the sole could be a bit cushier. i have plantar fasciitis and often have to wear inserts; a bit of cushion in the sole goes a long way for me. the plus is these shoes are roomy enough to add an insert without cramping the feet. will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: nottalfar

customer_reviews.title: Not slip proof
customer_reviews.text: Not slip proof! comfortable shoes for my commercial kitchen BUT not that safe, no different than wearing running shoes in the kitchen, shoes slide when coming into contact with water or grease, this is my third pair, sturdy shoes that lasted 6 months under heavy usage but they can be slippery
customer_reviews.author: Smacky

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, comfortable right out of the box. Good non-slip sole and waterproofing.- I wear them daily in the kitchen and dish room. They are "utility" dress so work well for back of the house work and running around the resort. Probably won't wear them just as a dress shoe, but great for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great work shoe that keep up with you all day!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these shoe for the last few years. Wear them everyday for work. Great price and no lost time shipping.
customer_reviews.author: MN GQ

customer_reviews.title: KEEN PTC WORK SHOES KICK BUTT!
customer_reviews.text: Thank god I found these shoes! Ever since Dexter shoes sold out and was killed off in anything but bowling shoes or a few womens types, the ones I have tried have been literaly killing me slowly! Within a few weeks of breaking these in ,I am a new man! These shoes are fantastic! Anyone who gripes about these shoes could never be satisfied! I spend hours on my feet everyday, I am convinced these are the best! Please KEEN dont change a thing and you will have me for life. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: A Person

customer_reviews.title: good value for price
customer_reviews.text: i really like this shoe. fit is perfect for my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: instant comfort
customer_reviews.text: The shoes felt "broken in" on the very first day of wear. Holding up to 14 hour days well. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great for work
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis and I’m a nurse. I’m always on my feet and I was always having trouble. Now I can work my 12 hour shift without complaints
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes but they squeak a lot you can hear me walking from blocks away.
customer_reviews.author: V. Gil

customer_reviews.title: Second Pair
customer_reviews.text: After a bit of confusion in packing for a combined trip to my girlfriend's and then on to my job 90 miles from home I found myself without my trusty Keens. Thanks to Amazon Prime I had a new pair waiting for me the next evening at the hotel. From the excellent non skid sole to the sturdy but attractive leather to the all-day comfortable insole, these have to be the work shoes of choice for anyone on his or her feet all day.
customer_reviews.author: W. R. Gailmard

customer_reviews.title: Nice roomy toebox!
customer_reviews.text: I usually have to get wide shoe sizes but tried these out anyway. They are wider with a roomy toe box which is perfect for me. No question about the quality or good looks. These shoes should last longer than most.
customer_reviews.author: THOTH

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but durability is questionable.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable as most Keen's are for my feet with high arches. I'm on my feet almost all day long and my feet aren't sore at the end of the day. Good traction, no sole separation. However, a seam near the laces began separating after 5 months, I adjusted laces to try to reduce separation to no avail. Disappointed. IMO $100 shoes should last longer than this.
customer_reviews.author: Martin L Willmarth

customer_reviews.title: GREAT when your on your feet!
customer_reviews.text: My feet used to ache and these shoes eliminated that and I'm on them for ten hours a day! Would definitely buy again and again. Thank you KEEN!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: No longer slip resistant
customer_reviews.text: I am a chef andI purchased these shoes to replace my other keen PTC work shoes. This pair is not good for working in a kitchen. They slip on any wet surface and are not safe for the kitchen. But, They are comfortable and good for standing long hours at a time. I would not recommend them for food service workers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THE SHOE MADE FOR WALING
customer_reviews.text: I PUT THESE SHOES ON right away after receiving them. My feet have not been this comfortable walking in years. They fit perfectly and let your feet spread and move freely as you walk. I love to walk and this shoe is the very very best for walking. I was entering a streetcar the other day and the Conductor asked if my shoes were KEEN. I said yes and told him to buy a pair. He said that he would purchase a pair.
customer_reviews.author: John F., Warris, III

customer_reviews.title: Get a size larger
customer_reviews.text: Going by size chart I would have gotten the size to small but earlier that day I was out looking at shoes and found that I had to go up in size if it's European. Fits great and non skid is great for the work I do. Comfort wise isn't where I would like it as I am on my feet 10+ hours a day but isn't the worst either.
customer_reviews.author: Nash D

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, can pass them off at work either at a meeting in khaki's and a polo or scrubs. Good fit, good support and long lasting. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Sean_RN

customer_reviews.title: Great for hours on your feet
customer_reviews.text: My son is a chef who is on his feet for hours. He loves the comfort and support of these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Howell

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy for some unknown reason, but I love the fit, comfort and quality. I walk a fair amount for work and this is the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, descent quality
customer_reviews.text: They fit wonderfully! The side ripped after a few months of basic office wear though.
customer_reviews.author: Coloradian 46

customer_reviews.title: Shoe squeaked
customer_reviews.text: Shoe had a squeak in it when I walked. Returned them
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Overholt

customer_reviews.title: my feet dont hurt any more
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet but not wide enough to fit larger sizes- This shoe was perfect. I'm on feet for 9 to 12 hrs and my feet dont hurt any more. They last about 6 mos
customer_reviews.author: Grumpyoldman32

customer_reviews.title: Noisy shoes
customer_reviews.text: Pros : Non-slip sole grip. Lots of toe room. Cons : Leather squeeks any movement.
customer_reviews.author: m. fung

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable. As a chef
customer_reviews.text: Seem durable and well constructed. Very comfortable. As a chef, I have been looking to find a successor to the Mozo Natural Leather since Mozo sold to Shoes for Crews and were discontinued. These shoes although well made otherwise have 0 slip resistance. Very disappointing for the price and potential with an otherwise well made shoe.
customer_reviews.author: awesome

customer_reviews.title: Nursing Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to lie, I'm a big fan of Keen products. I bought the shoes for nursing in an ICU unit. I was concerned about wearing them without break in. Wore then a couple of days around the house and then to the unit. Really comfortable and seem to help with leg and hip pain. Great shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Paincontrol

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: True length. Large toe box. Great shoe for the kitchen. They are not absolutely hideous like most kitchen shoes. They are kinda squeaky
customer_reviews.author: Colt G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Work Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love this shoe. Great for work. 3rd pair I've gone through. Lasts about 2 years of heavy walking on hard floor.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Family

customer_reviews.title: So nice we bought them twice.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as a gift for my son. This is his second pair. He works long hours on his feet and he Loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

product_meta.title: Keen Utility Men's PTC Dress Oxford-M Industrial Shoe
product_meta.description:
This high-comfort, low-profile work shoe is made of smooth, water-resistant leather that's easy to wipe clean. The sole is slip resistant, and a memory-foam footbed offers all-day cushioning.

The perfect fit for all-day comfort on the job, the PTC Oxford from KEEN features a slip resistant outsole, and water resistant leather upper for comfort and wipe-clean convenience. Inside, a plush KEEN.CUSH footbed made from PU, and memory foam cradles your foot in all-day comfort.

From beaches to mountains to city streets, Keen believes the outdoors is anyplace without a ceiling. Keen believes in living a HybridLife, which means being part of a greater community that is full of people who create possibilities, play in the outdoors and care for the world around them.

See more
feature_bullets: Shaft measures approximately low-top from arch
SAFETY FIRST: Features KEEN Patented Toe Protection, where the shoe outsoles wrap up and over the toes for ultimate protection; meets CSA Z195-09 Grade 1 standards for protection
PROTECT YOUR FEET: KEEN.Grip for oil- and slip-resistant outsoles that meet or exceed ASTM F1677-96 MARK II and ASTM F2913 SATRA nonslip testing standards
COMFORT IS KEY: KEEN.Cush is a blend of recycled PU, cork, and memory foam that contours to feet and adjusts to give you the cushioning you need throughout your day
WORK ALL DAY: Includes a compression moulded EVA midsole for all-day comfort
PREPARED FOR ANY JOB: Features a TPU stability shank and water- and stain-resistant leather upper
